citation.article-title: Saccharopolyspora endophytica sp. nov.,anendophyticactinomycete isolated fromtherootof Maytenus austroyunnanensis

p.s: Description of Saccharopolyspora endophytica sp. nov

Saccharopolyspora endophytica (en.do.phy′ti.ca. Gr. endo within; Gr. Phyton, plant; and L. suff. –icus, adjectival suffix used with the sense of belonging to; N.L. fem. adj. endophytica within plant, pertaining to the original isolation from plant tissues).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid–alcohol-fast, non-motile actinomycete that forms extensively branched substrate mycelia.
Good growth occurs on ISP 2, ISP 5, Czapek's agar and potato agar media.
White aerial hyphae are produced on most of the tested media.
Long spore chains are borne on aerial hyphae, and the spores are smooth and non-motile.
Pink diffusible pigments are observed on some agar media.
Temperature and pH ranges for growth are 20–45 °C and pH 5.0–9.0, respectively.
Optimal temperature and pH for growth are 37 °C and pH 7.0–7.5, respectively.
Able to degrade adenine, cellulose, chitin, hypoxanthine, starch, tyrosine, Tween 20, Tween 80 and xanthine, but not casein.
Milk is not coagulated and peptonized.
Aesculin and urea are not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is reduced, but H2S, melanin and urease are not produced.

Cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-ribose, d-xylose, erythritol, glucose, inositol, lactose, l-arabinose, l-rhamnose, malate, maltose, mannitol, mannose, raffinose, sorbitol, starch, sucrose, trehalose and xylitol are used as sole carbon and energy sources, whereas dulcitol, glycine, oxalate, propionate, sorbose and succinate cannot be used for growth.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 66.2 mol%.

The type strain YIM 61095T (=KCTC 19397T=CCTCC AA 208003T) was isolated from the surface-sterilized root of Maytenus austroyunnanensis collected from a tropical rainforest of Xishuangbanna, Yunnan Province, south-west China.
